newsitem.title: JAPAN: Jump in Japan trade, services surplus temporary-MOF.
newsitem.headline: Jump in Japan trade, services surplus temporary-MOF.

text.p: The increase in Japan's goods and services trade surplus is only temporary, Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka told reporters on Friday.
The trend in the surplus in the goods and services trade is still on a declining trend, Mitsuzuka said.
"Although I am not absolutely without worry, I see this as a temporary short-term fluctuation," he said.
The ministry announced on Wednesday that Japan's current account, the broadest measure of trade in goods and services, rose 154.9 percent to 906.8 billion yen in May from a year earlier.
"Capital investment, consumption and housing construction are increasing, which shows that domestic demand is firm. The (rise in the) surplus will gradually become moderate," he said.
Asked about his views on the economy after the release of the government's monthly economic report, Mitsuzuka said: "The report correctly indicates the direction the economy is heading."
The economy, despite a temporary slowdown, is continuing to recover, led by firm private demand, the Economic Planning Agency (EPA) said in its latest monthly report earlier on Friday.
"Although the tempo of the recovery has temporarily slowed down, the economy is continuing to recover centring around firm private demand," the report said.
